_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The ten roots of arguments [an10.43:1.5]: Explaining what is not an offense as an offense, and what is an offense as not an offense
Explaining a light offense as a serious offense, and a serious offense as a light offense

Explaining an offense committed with corrupt intention as an offense not committed with corrupt intention, and an offense not committed with corrupt intention as an offense committed with corrupt intention
Explaining an offense requiring rehabilitation as an offense not requiring rehabilitation, and an offense not requiring rehabilitation as an offense requiring rehabilitation
Explaining an offense with redress as an offense without redress, and an offense without redress as an offense with redress
